message: Has anyone seen this? What did you think? Is it too depressing or not?

I just saw this last night. It sits like a jewel in my mind. The performances are ripping good. Of course Nicole Kidman, but Aaron Eckhart surprised me - he more than held his own with Kidman, and he should have gotten an oscar nomination for best actor. This would not - and probably should not - be up for best picture because it is simply so sad. But in quality, it is really a jewel.
It must be said there are some funny spots too. My audience laughed in several spots.
We get so used to seeing Diane Wiest cast as "the mother" but she was so touching. Miles Teller was also pitch-perfect in a very crucial supporting role.

I should see this, but I've been avoiding it because it seems like the saddest thing. Aaron Eckhart's great. Check out Neil LaBute's "In the Company of Men" if you haven't seen it. He went to BYU with LaBute and he was in a lot of his early movies.
